cpu.definition: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is the main component that executes instructions and processes tasks on your system.
cpu.why_it_matters: CPU performance affects how fast applications run and how well your system handles multitasking.

ram.definition: RAM (Random Access Memory) is short-term memory used by running applications and the operating system.
ram.why_it_matters: Low available RAM can slow down your system or cause applications to freeze.

storage.definition: Storage is where your system permanently stores data, applications, and the operating system.
storage.why_it_matters: If storage becomes full, your system may fail to write logs, install updates, or even boot properly.
